instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: May I ask? Battery question
threads.message:
Now days battery have many sensor lines and +  and -. 

I have a battery at 0.1v when I plug in it the DC powersupply at its requested voltage. The battery won't draw any Amps and stays at 0 Amp consumption.

How do I make the battery hungry to be charged by a DC powersupply?

threads.title: May I ask? Battery question
threads.message:
The battery has an internal BMS.
Apart of SCL/SDA lines, has an enable pin; <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> usually.
The internal charge/discharge MOSFETs are controlled by BMS, which requires to talk with an external power management chip (like SMC).

threads.title: May I ask? Battery question
threads.message: so, its impossible to charge up a battery with DC Powersupply, or I have to find <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> and then the battery would alow charing on a DC Powersupply?

threads.title: May I ask? Battery question
threads.message:
You can buy some interface to charge/discharge laptop batteries.
Many available on Internet, not really cheap.
